aztecs.title: Infantry and Monk civilization
advantages: +5 Monk hit points for each Monastery technology

bengalis.title: Elephant and Naval civilization
advantages: Elephant units receive 25% less bonus damage and are more resistant to conversion
Town Centers spawn 2 Villagers when the next Age is reached
unique_techs: Paiks (Rathas and elephant units attack 20% faster)
bengalis.team_bonus: Trade units yield 10% food in addition to gold

berbers.title: Cavalry and Naval civilization
advantages: Stable units cost -15% in Castle, -20% in Imperial Age
berbers.team_bonus: Genitour available in the Archery Range starting in the Castle Age

bohemians.title: Gunpowder and Monk civilization
advantages: Chemistry and Hand Cannoneer available in Castle Age
unique_techs: Hussite Reforms (Monks and Monastery technologies have their gold cost replaced by food)

britons.title: Foot Archer civilization
advantages: Town Centers cost -50% wood starting in the Castle Age
Foot archers (except skirmishers) +1 range in Castle and Imperial Age (+2 total)
unique_techs: Yeomen (+1 foot archer range, +2 tower attack)

bulgarians.title: Infantry and Cavalry civilization
advantages: Blacksmith and Siege Workshop technologies cost -50% food

burgundians.title: Cavalry civilization
advantages: Economic upgrades available one age earlier and cost -50% food
Cavalier upgrade available in Castle Age
unique_techs: Burgundian Vineyards (Farmers slowly generate gold in addition to food)
Flemish Revolution (Upgrades all existing Villagers to Flemish Militia; create Flemish Militia at Town Centers)

burmese.title: Monk and Elephant civilization
advantages: Infantry +1 attack per age (starting in the Feudal Age)
burmese.team_bonus: Relics visible on the map at the start of the game

byzantines.title: Defensive civilization
advantages: Buildings +10% HP Dark, +20% Feudal, +30% Castle, +40% Imperial Age
Camel Riders, Skirmishers, Pikemen, Halberdiers cost -25%

celts.title: Infantry and Siege civilization
advantages: Infantry move 15% faster (starting in the Feudal Age)
Can steal sheep, and sheep within one Celt unit's LoS cannot be stolen

chinese.title: Archer civilization
advantages: Technologies cost -10% Feudal, -15% Castle, -20% Imperial Age
Town Centers support 10 population and +5 LOS

cumans.title: Cavalry civilization
advantages: Additional Town Center can be built in the Feudal Age
Siege Workshop and Battering Ram available in the Feudal Age; Capped Ram upgrade available in Castle Age
Archery Ranges and Stables cost -75 wood
Cavalry 5% faster each age (starting in Feudal Age)
unique_techs: Steppe Husbandry (Light Cavalry, Steppe Lancers and Cavalry Archers trained 100% faster)
Cuman Mercenaries (team members can create 5 free Elite Kipchaks per Castle)

dravidians.title: Infantry and Naval civilization
advantages: Receive +200 wood when advancing to the next age
Skirmishers and Elephant Archers attack 25% faster
unique_techs: Medical Corps (Elephant units regenerate 20 HP per minute)
Wootz Steel (Infantry and cavalry attacks ignore armor)

ethiopians.title: Archer and Siege civilization
advantages: Receive +100 gold, +100 food when advancing to the next age
unique_techs: Royal Heirs (Shotel Warriors train nearly instantly)
Torsion Engines (increases blast radius of Siege Workshop units)
ethiopians.team_bonus: Towers and Outposts +3 line of sight

franks.title: Cavalry civilization
advantages: Cavalry +20% hit points starting in Feudal Age

goths.title: Infantry civilization
advantages: Infantry cost -20% in Dark, -25% in Feudal, -30% in Castle, -35% in Imperial Age
Infantry +1 attack vs. buildings per age (starting from Feudal Age)
Villagers +5 attack vs. wild boar; hunters carry +15 meat

gurjaras.title: Cavalry and Camel civilization
advantages: Can garrison Mills with livestock to produce food
Can garrison Docks with Fishing Ships
unique_techs: Frontier Guards (Camel Riders and Elephant Archers +4 melee armor)
gurjaras.team_bonus: Camel and elephant units created 25% faster

hindustanis.title: Camel and Gunpowder civilization
advantages: Villagers cost -10% Dark, -15% Feudal, -20% Castle, -25% Imperial Age
Can build Caravanserai in Imperial Age
unique_techs: Grand Trunk Road (All gold income 10% faster)
hindustanis.team_bonus: Camel and light cavalry units +2 attack vs. buildings

huns.title: Cavalry civilization
advantages: Do not need houses, but start with -100 wood
Cavalry Archers cost -10% Castle, -20% Imperial Age
unique_techs: Atheism (+100 years Relic, Wonder victories; enemy relics generate -50% resources)

incas.title: Infantry civilization
advantages: Villagers affected by Blacksmith upgrades starting in the Castle Age
unique_techs: Andean Sling (Skirmishers and Slingers no minimum range)
incas.team_bonus: Spearmen and Skirmishers +2 line of sight

italians.title: Archer and Naval civilization
advantages: Advancing to the next age costs -15%
unique_techs: Pavise (foot archers and Condottieri +1 armor/+1 pierce armor)
italians.team_bonus: Condottiero available in the Barracks in Imperial Age

japanese.title: Infantry civilization
advantages: Fishing Ships 2x hit points; +2P armor; work rate +5% Dark, +10% Feudal, +15% Castle, +20% Imperial Age
Infantry attack 33% faster starting in Feudal Age

khmer.title: Siege and Elephant civilization
advantages: No buildings required to advance to the next age or to unlock other buildings
Farmers don't require Mills/Town Centers to drop off food
unique_techs: Double Crossbow (Ballista Elephants and Scorpions fire two projectiles)

koreans.title: Defensive and Naval civilization
advantages: Tower upgrades free (Bombard Tower requires Chemistry)
Military units (except siege weapons) cost -20% wood
unique_techs: Eupseong (Watch Towers, Guard Towers and Keeps +2 range)

lithuanians.title: Cavalry and Monk civilization
advantages: Each garrisoned relic gives +1 attack to Knights and Leitis (maximum +4)

magyars.title: Cavalry civilization
advantages: Forging, Iron Casting, Blast Furnace free
Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar cost -15%
unique_techs: Corvinian Army (Magyar Huszars cost no gold)

malay.title: Naval civilization
advantages: Advancing to the next age 66% faster
Fish Traps cost -33% and provide 3X food
Battle Elephants cost -30% in Castle, -40% in Imperial Age
unique_techs: Thalassocracy (upgrades Docks to Harbors, which fire arrows)
Forced Levy (Militia-line gold cost is replaced by additional food cost)

malians.title: Infantry civilization
advantages: Barracks units +1P armor per age (starting from Feudal Age)
unique_techs: Tigui (Town Centers fire arrows when ungarrisoned)

mayans.title: Archer civilization
advantages: Archers cost -10% Feudal, -20% Castle, -30% Imperial Age
unique_techs: Hul'che Javelineers (Skirmishers throw a second projectile)
El Dorado (Eagle Warriors have +40 hit points)

mongols.title: Cavalry Archer civilization
advantages: Light Cavalry, Hussars, Steppe Lancers +30% hit points
unique_techs: Nomads (lost houses do not decrease population headroom)
mongols.team_bonus: Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar +2 line of sight

persians.title: Cavalry civilization
advantages: Town Center, Dock 2x hit points; work rate +10% Feudal, +15% Castle, +20% Imperial Age
unique_techs: Kamandaran (Archer-line gold cost is replaced by additional wood cost)

poles.title: Cavalry civilization
advantages: Villagers regenerate 5 HP per minute in Dark, 10 in Feudal, 15 in Castle, 20 in Imperial Age
Stone Miners generate gold in addition to stone
unique_techs: Lechitic Legacy (Light Cavalry deals trample damage)
poles.team_bonus: Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar +1 attack vs. Archers

portugese.title: Naval and Gunpowder civilization
advantages: Can build Feitoria in Imperial Age
portugese.team_bonus: Line of sight is shared with the team starting in the Dark Age

saracens.title: Camel and Naval civilization
advantages: Transport Ships 2x hit points, 2x carry capacity

sicilians.title: Infantry and Cavalry civilization
advantages: Castles and Town Centers built 100% faster
Land military units (except siege weapons) receive 50% less bonus damage
unique_techs: First Crusade (Each Town Center (maximum 5) spawns a one-time batch of 7 Serjeants; units more resistant to conversion)
sicilians.team_bonus: Transport Ships +5 line of sight and cost -50%

slavs.title: Infantry and Siege civilization
unique_techs: Detinets (Replaces 40% of Castles' and Towers' stone cost with wood)

spanish.title: Gunpowder and Monk civilization
advantages: Cannon Galleons benefit from Ballistics (fire faster, more accurately)

tatars.title: Cavalry Archer civilization
advantages: New Town Centers spawn 2 Sheep starting in the Castle Age
Units deal +25% damage when fighting from higher elevation
unique_techs: Silk Armor (Light Cavalry, Steppe Lancers and Cavalry Archers receive +1/+1P armor)
Timurid Siegecraft (Trebuchets +2 range, enables Flaming Camels)

teutons.title: Infantry civilization
advantages: Barracks and Stable units +1 armor in Castle and Imperial Age (+2 total)
unique_techs: Crenellations (+3 range Castles garrisoned infantry fire arrows)

turks.title: Gunpowder civilization
advantages: Gunpowder units +25% hit points; researching gunpowder technologies costs -50%; Chemistry free
Scout Cavalry, Light Cavalry, Hussar +1P armor
Light Cavalry and Hussar upgrades free
unique_techs: Artillery (+2 range Bombard Towers, Bombard Cannons, Cannon Galleons)

vietnamese.title: Archer civilization
advantages: Enemy positions are revealed at the start of the game
unique_techs: Paper Money (Lumberjacks slowly generate gold in addition to wood)
vietnamese.team_bonus: Imperial Skirmisher upgrade available in the Imperial Age

vikings.title: Infantry and Naval civilization
advantages: Warships cost -15% Feudal Age, -15% Castle Age, -20% Imperial Age
Infantry +20% hit points starting in Feudal Age
unique_techs: Chieftains (infantry deal bonus damage to cavalry)
